TITLE: Cloning and Building the Project
DESCRIPTION: These commands clone the Steel MCP server repository, navigate to the project directory, install dependencies, and build the project using npm. This is a prerequisite for running the server in both cloud and local modes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/steel-dev/steel-mcp-server/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/steel-dev/steel-mcp-server.git
cd steel-mcp-server
npm install
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Local Development (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This bash command installs the necessary dependencies for local development of the Steel MCP Server. It uses `npm install` to install all packages listed in the `package.json` file of the project. This step is crucial for setting up the development environment before building and running the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/steel-dev/steel-mcp-server/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building the Steel MCP Server Project (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This bash command builds the Steel MCP Server project. It uses `npm run build` to execute the build script defined in the `package.json` file. This script typically compiles the source code, bundles the necessary files, and prepares the project for deployment or execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/steel-dev/steel-mcp-server/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Steel MCP Server (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This bash command starts the Steel MCP Server. It uses `npm start` to execute the start script defined in the `package.json` file. This script typically launches the server application, making it accessible for client requests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/steel-dev/steel-mcp-server/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Steel MCP Server via Smithery (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This bash command uses Smithery to install the Steel MCP Server for Claude Desktop. The command utilizes `npx` to execute the Smithery CLI, specifying the package `@steel-dev/steel-mcp-server` and indicating that the client is Claude. This command simplifies the installation process by automating dependency resolution and setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/steel-dev/steel-mcp-server/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
npx -y @smithery/cli install @steel-dev/steel-mcp-server --client claude
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Claude Desktop for Steel Voyager (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates how to configure Claude Desktop to utilize Steel Voyager. It defines an `mcpServers` entry with the name `steel-puppeteer`, specifying the command to execute (node), arguments including the path to the `steel-puppeteer` index.js file, and environment variables to control the execution mode (local or cloud) and API key.  The path to the `steel-puppeteer` and the API key must be properly set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/steel-dev/steel-mcp-server/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "steel-puppeteer": {
      "command": "node",
      "args": ["path/to/steel-puppeteer/dist/index.js"],
      "env": {
        "STEEL_LOCAL": "false",
        "STEEL_API_KEY": "your_api_key_here"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Environment Variables for Cloud Mode
DESCRIPTION: These commands set the environment variables required to run Steel Voyager in cloud mode. STEEL_LOCAL is set to false, and STEEL_API_KEY is set to the user's API key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/steel-dev/steel-mcp-server/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export STEEL_LOCAL="false"

export STEEL_API_KEY="YOUR_STEEL_API_KEY_HERE"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Environment Variables for Local Mode
DESCRIPTION: These commands set the environment variables required to run Steel Voyager in local mode.  STEEL_LOCAL is set to true, and STEEL_BASE_URL is optionally set to the address of the locally hosted Steel server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/steel-dev/steel-mcp-server/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export STEEL_LOCAL="true"

export STEEL_BASE_URL="http://localhost:3000" # only if overriding
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Claude Desktop for Steel Cloud
DESCRIPTION: This JSON configuration is added to the Claude Desktop settings to integrate the Steel MCP server running in cloud mode. It specifies the command to run the server, arguments, and environment variables, including the Steel API key and disabling local mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/steel-dev/steel-mcp-server/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "steel-puppeteer": {
      "command": "node",
      "args": ["path/to/steel-voyager/dist/index.js"],
      "env": {
        "STEEL_LOCAL": "false",
        "STEEL_API_KEY": "YOUR_STEEL_API_KEY_HERE",
        "GLOBAL_WAIT_SECONDS": "1"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Claude Desktop for Local Steel
DESCRIPTION: This JSON configuration is added to the Claude Desktop settings to integrate the Steel MCP server running in local mode. It specifies the command to run the server, arguments, and environment variables, including enabling local mode and setting the Steel base URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/steel-dev/steel-mcp-server/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "steel-puppeteer": {
      "command": "node",
      "args": ["path/to/steel-voyager/dist/index.js"],
      "env": {
        "STEEL_LOCAL": "true",
        "STEEL_BASE_URL": "http://localhost:3000",
        "GLOBAL_WAIT_SECONDS": "1"
      }
    }
  }
}
```
